title: Martin Ranch 2014 Therese Vineyards Dos Ninas Vineyard Syrah (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Deep and dark black currant, black plum, prune, dried sage and licorice spice show on the nose of this bottling. The dark dried fruit meets with a minty lift on the palate, proving relatively light in texture but with a strong, somewhat leathery tannic backbone.

title: Martin Schaetzel 2016 Cuvée Mathieu Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: With its cherry notes on the nose a little muddled, the palate nonetheless is bright fresh and vivid in a crunchy red-cherry note. This is simple and a little rustic, and would also work as a lightly chilled red.

title: Martin Schaetzel 2016 Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: A rather earthy nose leads onto the fresh, slender and balanced palate. The body has a kind of rustic simplicity, with honest, clean red-cherry fruit. This is easy and fresh and would be ideal for a country-style lunch. Drink soon.

title: Masseria Altemura 2014 Petravia Aglianico (Puglia)
description: Aromas of dense dark-skinned berries meet spicy tobacco on the nose. There's ample weight, acidity and tannins, with plenty of rich dark fruit spice to fill it out. Chalky tannins currently dominate the finish. Drink from 2022 for easier enjoyment.

title: Minimus 2016 Dijon Free Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Fully 70% was fermented whole cluster in neutral oak, yielding a wine with bright cranberry and raspberry fruit, juicy acids, and a touch of citrus. The wine avoids excessive stemmy flavors, though a bit of earthiness comes out in the tannins.

title: Monogram 2013 Dosage Zero  (Franciacorta)
description: Yellow stone fruit, toasted hazelnut and bread crust aromas indicate this is made primarily with Chardonnay. Reflecting the nose, the palate offers mature yellow apple, citrus rind and walnut alongside a bright perlage.

title: Monogram NV Satèn  (Franciacorta)
description: This offers delicate scents of spring blossom, white stone fruit and a whiff of bread crust. On the vivacious palate, vigorous bubbles and bright acidity frame yellow apple, chopped herb and tangerine zest.

title: Muruve 2014 Elite  (Toro)
description: Earthy, herbal aromas are a bit murky and reflect a marginal Toro vintage in 2014. A grabby, overextracted palate delivers rock-hard tannins along with gummy flavors of blackberry and blueberry. On the finish, creamy oak takes on a clove-like flavor.

title: Narmada 2012 Merlot (Virginia)
description: This Merlot brings a lot of aromas and flavors to the table, with tones of baked red and black fruits, nutmeg, clove and balsamic. The tannins are silky and the acidity gives a fresh lift to the feel.

title: Phelps Creek 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Gorge (OR))
description: This clean, grassy wine is a pure and pleasing example of varietal character, from a cool-climate region on the northern Oregon border. Lemon and lime rind and grapefruit flesh combine with plenty of lip-tingling acidity. It's not a big wine, but well done, lively and refreshing.

title: Pittacum 2014 Val de la Loba Paraje Singular Mencía (Bierzo)
description: A pinched, rubbery nose hints at volatility. In the mouth, this single-vineyard Mencía is wiry, tough and high in tartaric acidity. Savory, saucy plum and berry flavors are salty on a dense finish.
designation: Val de la Loba Paraje Singular

title: Poggio al Tufo 2015 Rompicollo  (Maremma Toscana)
description: A blend of Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon, this easygoing red has aromas of iris, underbrush band and Mediterranean scrub. The juicy palate delivers Marasca cherry, white pepper and tobacco alongside velvety tannins. It's made to be drunk young so enjoy soon.

title: Polvanera 2013 Aglianico (Puglia)
description: Light aromas of cherry, currant and wild herbs carry the nose. Medium in weight, with vibrant acidity countering sandy tannins, crunchy red fruit flavors dominate the palate, yet are restrained by a core of granite and crushed herbs.

title: Portal del Priorat 2014 Luno Red (Montsant)
description: Lightly spiced plum aromas are minerally and come with a hint of nutmeg. A flush, bouncy palate is made tougher by rubbery tannins, while spicy plum and blueberry flavors are solid through the back end. The blend offers Grenache, Syrah, Carignan and Cabernet Sauvignon.

title: Prats & Symington LDA 2016 Prazo de Roriz Red (Douro)
description: This second wine from Quinta de Roriz is ready to drink young, with warm red fruits, soft tannins and juicy acidity. It has structure as well, which will allow it to develop further although it is already delicious and juicy. Drink now or wait until 2019.

title: Quinta da Romaneira 2015 Sino da Romaneira Red (Douro)
description: The second wine of this great Douro quinta is generous and warm, made to be drunk young. Its rich tannins are equalled by the licorice and ripe black-fruit flavors, smooth structure and good acidity. Drink this wine from late 2018.

title: Real Companhia Velha 2015 Quinta dos Aciprestes Red (Douro)
description: The vineyards on the south bank of the Douro face north, giving respite from the sun and producing an elegant style of wine. This is perfumed, fruity and concentrated from the old vines used in the blend. Drink this juicy wine from 2019.

title: Ricci Curbastro NV Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Delicate aromas of baking spice and red plum come together on this. Made entirely with Sangiovese, the palate delivers wild cherry, vanilla and a touch of coconut alongside round tannins.

title: Rivera 2012 Cappellaccio Aglianico (Castel del Monte)
description: Dense dark fruit aromas blend with sweet tobacco leaf and anise on the nose. Solidly built with grippy tannins and structured acidity, the palate offers a good concentration of more dark fruit, invigorated by accents of spice and crushed herbs.

title: Rocca di Montemassi 2016 Calasole White (Maremma Toscana)
description: Aromas of white flower, beeswax and stone fruit mingle in the glass. The lively palate delivers Bartlett pear, white peach and a touch of ginger alongside fresh acidity.

title: Rock Point NV River Red (Oregon)
description: This is principally Syrah and Merlot, with smaller amounts of other Bordeaux grapes in the mix. It's fruity, fresh and flavorful, with berries and cherries in abundance, along with scents and flavors of smoke and roasted coffee. Call it a fine, gulpable, everyday red.

title: Rock View 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: There's a decent serving of thyme and sagebrush on the nose of this affordable bottling alongside the piquant raspberry and cranberry fruit, with a touch of wet earth in the background. The decently weighted palate shows cranberry and more dried herbs, gaining complexity toward the finish.

title: Schmidt 2014 Pinot Noir (Applegate Valley)
description: Pinot Noir is most often done in a rounder fruitier style in Southern Oregon, and this pins the tail on that characteristic. It's a sturdy, blocky and tasty wine—a bit tannic, with flavors of black cherry, dried herbs and a lick of espresso.

title: Sokol Blosser 2015 Twelve Row Block Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The price and special designation suggest that this is considered a reserve-level cuvée. It seems quite dry, even astringent, with tea-flavored tannins around thin berry fruit. There are hints of mint, wintergreen and chocolate, but the wine doesn't show much depth. Perhaps more bottle age is needed. Two bottles were tasted with comparable notes.

title: Tenute Chiaromonte 2015 Nigredo Primitivo (Puglia)
description: A mix of jammy red and black berries mix with Mediterranean herbs and violets on the nose. Despite the weighty alcohol, the palate maintains a nice balance of rich berry fruit cut with juicy acidity.

title: Tormaresca 2015 Torcicoda Primitivo (Salento)
description: Red cherry and blackberry aromas meld with snippets of baking spice and menthol on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is firm, with structured tannins and crisp acidity, housing juicy berry flavors dotted with red floral tones. Dark plum rounds out the finish.

title: Villa 2011 Extra Brut Extra Blue  (Franciacorta)
description: This offers aromas of yellow stone fruit and a whiff of medicinal herb that carry over to the sharp palate along with yellow apple skin and toasted nut. A vigorous perlage invigorates the finish.

title: Villa Pinciana 2012 Terraria  (Maremma Toscana)
description: A blend of 45% Sangiovese, 45% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Petit Verdot, this has delicate aromas of tilled soil and black-skinned berry. The firm palate offers black-currant jam, tobacco and leather alongside closed-grained tannins.

title: Willm 2016 Réserve Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Just a touch of red cherry fruit show on the nose. The palate is light and slender but fresh in feel, with smooth, unobtrusive tannins. This will work well chilled. Drink soon.

title: Brander 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Los Olivos District)
description: Broad black cherry aromas meet with soft touches of rosewater, star anise and hibiscus on this rather light bottling. It's very fresh on the palate, with lively pomegranate and berry flavors, though not much of the dark spice or tannic depth expected of the grape.
